Package org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.competition.utils

Class Motor

java.lang.Object
org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.competition.utils.Motor
public class Motor extends Object
Represents a motor attached to the robot.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Motor

      public Motor​(Telemetry telemetry, HardwareMap hardware, String name, DcMotorSimple.Direction offset, double countsPerRev, double gearReduction, double radius)
      Creates a reference to a complex motor on the robot. This motor can drive to a position, unlike the simple variant.
      Parameters:
      telemetry - The telemetry object to log data to.
      hardware - The hardware object to locate the motor with.
      name - The name of the motor as listed on the FtcRobotController device.
      offset - The directional offset of the motor. This can be useful if a motor is mounted the opposite way it should be, for example upside down.
      countsPerRev - The amount of encoder steps per motor revolution.
      gearReduction - The reduction ratio of the motor's gearing.
      radius - The radius of the motor's attachment.

    • Motor

      public Motor​(Telemetry telemetry, HardwareMap hardware, String name, DcMotorSimple.Direction offset)
      Creates a reference to a simple motor on the robot This motor can't drive a distance, but can drive with and without the encoder.
      Parameters:
      telemetry - The telemetry object to log data to.
      hardware - The hardware object to locate the motor with.
      name - The name of the motor as listed on the FtcRobotController device.
      offset - The directional offset of the motor. This can be useful if a motor is mounted the opposite way it should be, for example upside down.

  • Method Details

    • driveDistance

      public void driveDistance​(int distance, int speed) throws IllegalArgumentException, IllegalStateException
      Drives the motor a certain distance.
      Parameters:
      distance - The distance to drive in inches.
      speed - The maximum speed of the motor. The speed may be anywhere between -1 and this value, depending on where the motor is. This value cannot be below 0 though.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - The error to throw when the maximum speed is not between -100 and 100.
      IllegalStateException - The error to throw when the motor's TYPE != MotorType.COMPLEX.

    • driveWithEncoder

      public void driveWithEncoder​(int speed) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Drives the motor at a certain speed.
      Parameters:
      speed - The speed to set the motor to.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - The error thrown when the speed is not between -100 and 100.

    • driveWithoutEncoder

      public void driveWithoutEncoder​(int power) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sends a certain voltage to the motor.
      Parameters:
      power - The voltage to send to the motor.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - The error thrown when the voltage is not between -100 and 100.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Bring the motor to a stop and reset the encoder.

    • brake

      public void brake()
      Bring the motor to a stop.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Reset the encoder.
